keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: On March 11, President Nixon reiterated his long-standing opposition to eliminating the criminal penalties for use, possession or sale of marijuana. In so doing, he ignored the findings of every major study and official inquiry about marijuana, and disregarded the conclusions of the National Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse, which he appointed.
